Articles.Content: We've had a couple of discussions about younger forum members, but does anyone know who is the oldest forum member here?

Depends what you are referring to. If you are talking about time spent as a member of the forum then Columbia is correct. If you are talking about biological age then we may never know due to the anonymity of the Internet.
I'm referring to biological age. I'm wondering which of the active forum members is the oldest biologically.
The oldest is definately SQUAD, as he is a deity existing since the creation of Kerbol. Hail SQUAD.

We've had a couple of discussions about younger forum members, but does anyone know who is the oldest forum member here?

Ive seen some say they are in their 40's or higher. And judging from the 'put a face to the name' thread I believe that. I am not far off that age..

Fun fact: HarvesteR's account is actually the fourth account made on this forum.

I know several people here that are in their 50s. No names though, not my info to share.
I know on one of the two english facebook groups there is a few 60yr olds.

Fun fact: HarvesteR's account is actually the fourth account made on this forum.

I know several people here that are in their 50s. No names though, not my info to share.

It seems Alex and some guy named alejandro were faster... But a number one doesnÃ‚Â´t exist!

Ive seen some say they are in their 40's or higher. And judging from the 'put a face to the name' thread I believe that. I am not far off that age..

40+? 100% guaranteed! 50+? Pretty sure there are more than a few of those too.

Just look at the regular streamers. I've seen some pretty deep wrinkles here and there. And those require either a lot of years or some darned hard living.

I watched the Apollo 11 moon landing on TV.

Happy landings!

I watched the Apollo 11 moon landing on TV.

Happy landings!

So...you're older/slightly younger than my dad....

OK, I guess I'll be the first to actually admit my age... I'm 53. I remember watching the Moon landings from my grandparent living room floor... I remember the very first Star Treks.. And I read the book Star Wars in high school a year before the first movie as released.

Maybe you win, Jim.

But my hunch is that there are members out there older than you.

Happy landings!
